result.execSummary:
The defendant Dontrail J Butcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 2nd Degree Sexual Assault of Child, a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.02(2).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay all costs, assessments and victim witness surcharges, and DNA surcharge.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended supervision.  Failure to pay all costs, assessments and surcharges will result in entry of a civil judgment.
Concurrent with: Concurrent with any other sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: No contact with persons under the age of 17 years, excluding own child.

Sex offender assessment and treatment, mental health assessment and treatment.
File as a sex offender.

supervisions.notes:
Provide DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Defendant advised: as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor; and that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Dontrail J Butcher

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING Transcript (22 pages) commencing 7/24/14 received and filed.

Defendant Dontrail J Butcher in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Dontrail J Butcher in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
The State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by: Lorraine J. and Tammy B.
The Court sentenced the defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT of 50 MONTHS in the Wisconsin State Prisons, credit for 135 days time served, concurrent with any other sentence.  CONFINEMENT of 14 MONTHS  and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 36 MONTHS with the following conditions:
-The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges, DNA surcharge be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of prison account under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  
-Pay all costs, assessments and victim/witness surcharges.
-Provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
FAILURE TO PAY ALL COSTS, ASSESSMENTS AND SURCHARGES WILL RESULT IN ENTRY OF CIVIL JUDGMENT.
-Sex offender assessment and treatment; mental health assessment and treatment.
-File as a sex offender.
-No contact with persons under the age of 17 years, excluding own child.
The defendant is advised as a convicted felon he may not carry or possess any firearms/body armor.
The court advises the defendant that voting privileges are suspended during the length of this sentence.
The defendant is given a written explanation of the determinate sentence, and advised of his appeal rights by defense counsel.
The defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program.   
The defendant is not eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.   
Defendant remanded.
Filed;
-Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement;
-Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
-Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
-Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Sentencing documents filed by defense counsel.

Defendant Dontrail J Butcher in court with attorney Victoria M McCandless.  Defendant Dontrail J Butcher in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
As to the charged offense:  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, and further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. Defendant examined as to plea, and entered a plea of guilty.  Court found defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived all constitutional rights. Plea questionnaire waiver of rights and addendum to plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulated to the criminal complaint as factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered into the record.  The Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon not to possess any firearms/body armor.    Court further advised defendant of voting ineligibility.   
Parties waive PSI.  Case is adjourned to 7-24-2014 at 8:15am for sentencing.  Court remands defendant.

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Dontrail J Butcher not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State has tendered an offer to the defense.  Counsel states that she does not believe that this case is in a trial posture; defendant will not be requesting a speedy trial.  Negotiations are on-going.  Case set for final pretrial on 6-25-2014.

Attorney Victoria M McCandless in court, defendant Dontrail J Butcher not in court, in custody.  Jennifer L Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Offer has just been presented to defense.  Defense counsel will be meeting with defendant to discuss offer.  Defendant has revocation pending.  Defendant may wish to enter a speedy trial demand.  Case is set for pretrial on 5-8-2014 and a jury trial date of 7-21-2014, both at 8:15.  Final pretrial date to be set on 5-8-14.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for July 21, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Dontrail J Butcher in court with attorney Victoria M. McCandless.  Defendant Dontrail J Butcher in custody.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
  Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 18, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  To be monitored by drug testing.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with M.A.W. (DOB:  04/05/1998) or Monique V. or Victor H. or their home/work/school/family.

Defendant Dontrail J Butcher in court with attorney Alejandro A. Lockwood.  Defendant Dontrail J Butcher in custody.  Cynthia M. Davis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
